storyTitle: As Integration Engineer, I want to establish secure API connections to HR systems to achieve reliable data exchange

testCases.title: Validate successful API connection and data retrieval
preconditions: Integration console is accessible and operational
Valid API credentials for HR system are available
HR system API is online and responding
Network connectivity is stable
User has Integration Engineer role and permissions
HR system contains employee data to be synchronized

steps.action: Navigate to the integration console and locate the HR system API configuration section
steps.expectedResult: Integration console loads successfully and API configuration section is displayed

steps.action: Enter valid API credentials (API key/OAuth token) in the designated fields
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted and input fields display masked values for security

steps.action: Click the 'Test Connection' or 'Authenticate' button
steps.expectedResult: System validates credentials, establishes secure connection with HR system, and displays 'Connection Successful' message

steps.action: Save the API configuration settings
steps.expectedResult: Configuration is saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the data synchronization section and click 'Trigger Sync' or 'Start Synchronization' button
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization process initiates and progress indicator is displayed

steps.action: Monitor the synchronization process until completion
steps.expectedResult: Employee data is retrieved from HR system via API, data mapping is applied correctly, and synchronization completes successfully with status 'Sync Complete'

steps.action: Verify the synchronized employee data in the platform database
steps.expectedResult: Employee records are present, all fields are mapped correctly, and data integrity is maintained without corruption

steps.action: Navigate to the logs section and filter for connection and data transfer events
steps.expectedResult: Logs display successful connection establishment with timestamp, authentication success, data retrieval events, and successful data sync completion with timestamps

postconditions: API connection to HR system is established and active
Employee data is synchronized in platform database
Connection and sync events are logged with timestamps
System is ready for subsequent synchronization operations

testCases.title: Verify retry mechanism on transient API failure
preconditions: API connection to HR system is configured with valid credentials
Integration console is operational
Network simulation tools are available to simulate transient failures
Retry mechanism is configured to attempt up to 3 retries
User has Integration Engineer role and permissions

steps.action: Configure network simulation tool to introduce transient network failure during API call
steps.expectedResult: Network simulation tool is configured and ready to interrupt connection

steps.action: Initiate data synchronization from the integration console
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization process starts and attempts to connect to HR system API

steps.action: Trigger the simulated transient network failure during the API call
steps.expectedResult: API call fails due to network interruption and system detects the failure

steps.action: Observe system behavior after initial failure
steps.expectedResult: System automatically initiates first retry attempt without manual intervention

steps.action: Allow retry attempts to continue while network failure persists (up to 2 more retries)
steps.expectedResult: System performs second and third retry attempts as configured, with appropriate wait intervals between retries

steps.action: Restore network connectivity before retry limit is exhausted
steps.expectedResult: Network connection is restored and becomes stable

steps.action: Observe the next retry attempt after network restoration
steps.expectedResult: System successfully establishes connection to HR system API and completes data synchronization successfully

steps.action: Navigate to logs section and review connection attempt records
steps.expectedResult: Logs show initial connection failure with timestamp, all retry attempts (1st, 2nd, 3rd) with timestamps, and final successful connection and data sync completion

steps.action: Verify synchronized data integrity in platform database
steps.expectedResult: Employee data is complete and accurate despite transient failures during sync process

postconditions: Data synchronization completed successfully after retry
All retry attempts are logged with timestamps
Employee data is synchronized without data loss
System demonstrates resilience to transient failures

testCases.title: Test handling of invalid API credentials
preconditions: Integration console is accessible and operational
Invalid API credentials are prepared for testing (incorrect API key or expired OAuth token)
User has Integration Engineer role and permissions
Logging system is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the integration console and locate the HR system API configuration section
steps.expectedResult: Integration console loads successfully and API configuration section is displayed

steps.action: Enter invalid API credentials (incorrect API key or malformed OAuth token) in the credential fields
steps.expectedResult: Invalid credentials are entered and displayed in masked format

steps.action: Click the 'Test Connection' or 'Authenticate' button
steps.expectedResult: System attempts to validate credentials with HR system API

steps.action: Observe the authentication response
steps.expectedResult: System rejects the invalid credentials and displays clear error message such as 'Authentication Failed: Invalid API credentials' or 'Invalid API key provided'

steps.action: Verify that no connection is established to the HR system
steps.expectedResult: Connection status shows 'Not Connected' or 'Authentication Failed', and no active connection exists

steps.action: Attempt to save the configuration with invalid credentials
steps.expectedResult: System prevents saving invalid configuration or saves with 'Inactive' status

steps.action: Attempt to trigger data synchronization with invalid credentials
steps.expectedResult: System blocks synchronization attempt and displays error message indicating authentication is required

steps.action: Navigate to the error logs section and search for authentication failure events
steps.expectedResult: Error log entry is present showing authentication failure, invalid credentials error, timestamp of the attempt, and relevant error details

steps.action: Verify error log contains sufficient detail for troubleshooting
steps.expectedResult: Log entry includes timestamp, error type (Authentication Error), error message, attempted credential identifier (without exposing sensitive data), and HR system endpoint attempted

postconditions: No API connection is established to HR system
Invalid credentials are not saved or marked as inactive
Authentication failure is logged with timestamp and error details
System security is maintained by rejecting invalid credentials
No data synchronization occurred

storyTitle: As Integration Engineer, I want to establish secure API connections to timekeeping systems to achieve reliable time log synchronization

testCases.title: Validate successful connection and time log retrieval
preconditions: Integration console is accessible and operational
Valid API credentials for timekeeping system are available
Timekeeping system API is online and responding
Network connectivity is stable
User has Integration Engineer role and permissions
Timekeeping system contains time log data to be synchronized

steps.action: Navigate to the integration console and locate the timekeeping system API configuration section
steps.expectedResult: Integration console loads successfully and timekeeping API configuration section is displayed

steps.action: Enter valid timekeeping API credentials (API token/OAuth credentials) in the designated fields
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted and input fields display masked values for security

steps.action: Click the 'Test Connection' or 'Authenticate' button
steps.expectedResult: System validates credentials, establishes secure connection with timekeeping system using OAuth 2.0 and TLS encryption, and displays 'Connection Successful' message

steps.action: Save the timekeeping API configuration settings
steps.expectedResult: Configuration is saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the time log synchronization section and click 'Trigger Sync' or 'Start Time Log Synchronization' button
steps.expectedResult: Time log synchronization process initiates and progress indicator is displayed

steps.action: Monitor the synchronization process until completion
steps.expectedResult: Time log data is retrieved from timekeeping system via API, data transformation is applied correctly, and synchronization completes successfully with status 'Sync Complete'

steps.action: Verify the synchronized time log data in the platform database
steps.expectedResult: Time log records are present, all fields (employee ID, clock in/out times, dates) are mapped correctly, no duplicate entries exist, and data integrity is maintained

steps.action: Navigate to the synchronization logs section and filter for time log sync events
steps.expectedResult: Logs display successful connection establishment with timestamp, authentication success, time log retrieval events, data transformation activities, and successful sync completion with timestamps

steps.action: Verify sync status display in the integration console
steps.expectedResult: Sync status shows 'Last Sync: Successful', timestamp of last sync, number of records synchronized, and next scheduled sync time if applicable

postconditions: API connection to timekeeping system is established and active
Time log data is synchronized in platform database
No duplicate time entries exist
Synchronization events are logged with timestamps
System is ready for subsequent synchronization operations

testCases.title: Test conflict resolution during time log synchronization
preconditions: API connection to timekeeping system is configured with valid credentials
Integration console is operational
Conflicting time log entries exist in source timekeeping system (e.g., overlapping time entries, duplicate clock-ins)
Predefined conflict resolution rules are configured in the system
User has Integration Engineer role and permissions
Platform database contains existing time log data that may conflict with source data

steps.action: Verify that conflicting time log entries exist in the source timekeeping system (e.g., same employee with overlapping time periods or duplicate entries)
steps.expectedResult: Conflicting time log entries are confirmed in source system

steps.action: Review the predefined conflict resolution rules configured in the system (e.g., 'latest timestamp wins', 'source system priority', 'manual review required')
steps.expectedResult: Conflict resolution rules are displayed and confirmed as active

steps.action: Initiate time log synchronization from the integration console
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization process starts and begins retrieving time log data from timekeeping system

steps.action: Monitor synchronization process as it encounters conflicting entries
steps.expectedResult: System detects conflicts during sync process and displays notification or warning indicating 'Conflicts Detected' with count of conflicting records

steps.action: Observe the automatic application of predefined conflict resolution rules
steps.expectedResult: System automatically applies configured resolution rules to conflicting entries without manual intervention

steps.action: Wait for synchronization process to complete
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization completes successfully with status 'Sync Complete with Conflicts Resolved' and summary of resolved conflicts

steps.action: Verify the final synchronized time log data in the platform database
steps.expectedResult: Time log data reflects accurately resolved conflicts according to predefined rules, no data loss occurred, duplicate entries are eliminated, and data integrity is maintained

steps.action: Review specific conflicting records to confirm correct resolution
steps.expectedResult: Each previously conflicting record shows the correct resolution (e.g., latest entry retained, older entry archived or merged) as per configured rules

steps.action: Navigate to synchronization logs and review conflict resolution events
steps.expectedResult: Logs show conflict detection events with timestamps, details of conflicting entries, applied resolution rules, and final resolution outcomes

steps.action: Verify no time log data was lost during conflict resolution
steps.expectedResult: All original data is either retained, merged, or archived according to rules; no unintended data deletion occurred

postconditions: Time log synchronization completed successfully
All conflicts resolved according to predefined rules
No data loss occurred during conflict resolution
Conflict resolution events are logged with details
Platform database contains accurate, deduplicated time log data

testCases.title: Verify handling of invalid API credentials
preconditions: Integration console is accessible and operational
Invalid API credentials for timekeeping system are prepared for testing (incorrect token or expired credentials)
User has Integration Engineer role and permissions
Logging system is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the integration console and locate the timekeeping system API configuration section
steps.expectedResult: Integration console loads successfully and timekeeping API configuration section is displayed

steps.action: Enter invalid timekeeping API credentials (incorrect API token, expired OAuth token, or malformed credentials) in the credential fields
steps.expectedResult: Invalid credentials are entered and displayed in masked format

steps.action: Click the 'Test Connection' or 'Authenticate' button
steps.expectedResult: System attempts to validate credentials with timekeeping system API

steps.action: Observe the authentication response
steps.expectedResult: System rejects the invalid credentials and displays clear error message such as 'Authentication Failed: Invalid API credentials', 'Token expired', or 'Invalid token provided'

steps.action: Verify that no connection is established to the timekeeping system
steps.expectedResult: Connection status shows 'Not Connected' or 'Authentication Failed', and no active connection exists to timekeeping system

steps.action: Attempt to save the configuration with invalid credentials
steps.expectedResult: System prevents saving invalid configuration or saves with 'Inactive' or 'Error' status

steps.action: Attempt to trigger time log synchronization with invalid credentials
steps.expectedResult: System blocks synchronization attempt and displays error message indicating 'Authentication required' or 'Invalid credentials - synchronization cannot proceed'

steps.action: Navigate to the error logs section and search for authentication failure events
steps.expectedResult: Error log entry is present showing authentication failure for timekeeping system

steps.action: Verify error log contains complete details with timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Log entry includes precise timestamp, error type (Authentication Error), detailed error message, attempted credential identifier (without exposing sensitive data), timekeeping system endpoint attempted, and error code if applicable

steps.action: Confirm no time log data was accessed or synchronized
steps.expectedResult: Platform database shows no new time log entries, and no synchronization activity occurred

postconditions: No API connection is established to timekeeping system
Invalid credentials are not saved or marked as inactive
Authentication failure is logged with timestamp and comprehensive error details
System security is maintained by rejecting invalid credentials
No time log synchronization occurred
No unauthorized access to timekeeping data
